definition[0]: a large payment of money to someone, for example from an insurance claim or from winning a competition
example[0]: There should be a big payout on this month’s lottery.
example[1]: Some of the victims have been offered massive cash payouts.
definition[1]: a large sum of money, given to someone for the work they have done
example[2]: an increase in commission payouts for some top-producing brokers
definition[2]: a payment made to someone who has made an insurance claim
example[3]: The insurance company’s profits fell 13% because of big payouts related to a series of hurricanes.
definition[3]: a DIVIDEND payment (=part of a company’s profits for a particular period of time paid to people who own shares in it)
example[4]: The board voted to cut the payouts in response to current operating results.
